item.title: 2021 Summer: Harvard University
item.description: Worked in Dr. William Renthal’s lab with single-cell ATAC-seq data on a project about cell-specific epigenetic regulation in the Dorsal Root Ganglion. Link to the lab website: https://renthal.bwh.harvard.edu/ Integrated single-cell RNAseq and ATACseq datasets. Performed differential open-chromatin analysis and transcriptional motif enrichment using the Signac package. Created a shinyapp that visualizes open-chromatin areas from the dataset along with gene expression data for each cell type (Deployment on the web is still in progress).

item.title: 2021-2022 (Bachelor-Thesis): Yale-NUS College
item.description: Bachelor-thesis titled â€œCosmetic neurology at scale: developing a high-throughput phenotypic screening for novel nootropics in D. melanogasterâ€ supervised by Dr. Jan Gruber. Optimized drug delivery (CAFÃ‰ feeding assay) and 3 different behavioral tests for automation purposes. Independently performed statistical analysis (power calculations, t-test, ANOVA) and visualizations of experimental data using R. Created hypoxia recovery assay to model recovery from anesthesia in fruit flies. Discovered that lacing fly food with caffeine, nicotine, modafinil, and l-theanine all improve the rate of recovery from CO2 anesthesia in relation to sucrose-fed flies.

item.title: About
item.description: I am a Lithuanian neuroscientist working in Singapore. I came to Singapore in 2018, when I decided that I want to continue my education 9000 km away from Lithuania at Yale-NUS college. Yale-NUS College is a liberal arts college in Singapore. Established in 2011 as a collaboration between Yale University and the National University of Singapore, it was the first liberal arts college in Singapore and one of the first few in Asia.

item.title: Current Project: Genome Institute of Singapore
item.description: I am currently working as a 80% dry-lab, 20% wet-lab research assistant in the single-cell spatial neuromics lab led by Dr. Jinyue Liu. The lab uses single-cell RNA-seq (scRNAseq) in tandem with multiplexed error-robust fluorescence in situ hybridization (MERFISH) in studying human psychiatric diseases like Parkinson’s disease and autism. The lab employs a human disease model called cerebral brain organoids which are stem-cell-derived “mini-brains” that are similar to 10-week-old human fetus brains.

item.title: Mentorship: Academic Buddy LT
item.description: Academic Buddy LT is a Lithuanian non-profit organization that connects Lithuanian undergraduates studying in top US universities with the most prospective Lithuanian high-schoolers. Having benefited from this mentorship network myself, I seek to give back by mentoring students myself. I have been mentoring students since 2019. My mentorship usually entails helping the students craft narratives in their application essays, tips on how to most cost-effective ways to prepare for admissions tests (SAT, ACT), and performing mock interviews.

item.title: Science-communication: Integrative Neuroscience Association (INA)
